RoutingProfileArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the routing profile.

BehaviorType.description: Specifies the other channels that can be routed to an agent handling their current channel.

CrossChannelBehavior.description: Defines the cross-channel routing behavior that allows an agent working on a contact in one channel to be offered a contact from a different channel.

Channel.description: The channels that agents can handle in the Contact Control Panel (CCP).

Concurrency.description:
The number of contacts an agent can have on a channel simultaneously.

Valid Range for `VOICE` : Minimum value of 1. Maximum value of 1.

Valid Range for `CHAT` : Minimum value of 1. Maximum value of 10.

Valid Range for `TASK` : Minimum value of 1. Maximum value of 10.

CrossChannelBehavior.description: Defines the cross-channel routing behavior for each channel that is enabled for this Routing Profile. For example, this allows you to offer an agent a different contact from another channel when they are currently working with a contact from a Voice channel.

MediaConcurrency.description: Contains information about which channels are supported, and how many contacts an agent can have on a channel simultaneously.

Delay.description: The delay, in seconds, a contact should be in the queue before they are routed to an available agent. For more information, see [Queues: priority and delay](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/connect/latest/adminguide/concepts-routing-profiles-priority.html) in the *Amazon Connect Administrator Guide* .

Priority.description: The order in which contacts are to be handled for the queue. For more information, see [Queues: priority and delay](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/connect/latest/adminguide/concepts-routing-profiles-priority.html) .

QueueReference.description: Contains information about a queue resource.

RoutingProfileQueueConfig.description: Contains information about the queue and channel for which priority and delay can be set.

Channel.description: The channels agents can handle in the Contact Control Panel (CCP) for this routing profile.

QueueArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the queue.

RoutingProfileQueueReference.description: Contains the channel and queue identifier for a routing profile.

AgentAvailabilityTimer.description: Whether agents with this routing profile will have their routing order calculated based on *time since their last inbound contact* or *longest idle time* .

DefaultOutboundQueueArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the default outbound queue for the routing profile.

Description.description: The description of the routing profile.

InstanceArn.description: The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance.

MediaConcurrencies.description: The channels agents can handle in the Contact Control Panel (CCP) for this routing profile.

Name.description: The name of the routing profile.

QueueConfigs.description: The inbound queues associated with the routing profile. If no queue is added, the agent can make only outbound calls.

Tags.description: The tags used to organize, track, or control access for this resource. For example, { "Tags": {"key1":"value1", "key2":"value2"} }.
